metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15677 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
By exploiting an Open Redirect vulnerability on a website, an attacker could have spoofed the site displayed in the download file dialog to show the original site (the one suffering from the open redirect) rather than the site the file was actually downloaded from. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 81, Thunderbird < 78.3, and Firefox ESR < 78.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
